Tuple[Dict, Dict, Dict]

seyfert.fisher.fisher_computation.compute_delta_cls(ws, fcfg, fish_cfg)¶
seyfert.fisher.fisher_computation.compute_fisher_for_datavector(datavector, params, derivs, delta_cls, auto_ells=None, auto_f_ells=None, name=None)¶

This function computes the Fisher matrix for a given datavector. We assume that the various probes have a common range of ells, but we also allow for each probe to have exclusive ells, which are not in the common range. This function takes this fact into account: first it computes the fisher for the specified datavector, which is defined only from the common range of ells. Then it loops through the single probes involved and for each probe it checks if there are any exclusive ells. If so, it computes the fisher matrix coming from the contribution of those exclusive ells, and then it adds to the fisher computed before.

Parameters

  • name (Optional[str]) – the name of the Fisher matrix

  • datavector (List[Tuple[str, str]]) – the datavector with the observables to combine

  • params (PhysicalParametersCollection) – the physical parameter collection with all cosmological and nuisance parameters

  • derivs (Dict[str, ClDict]) – the dictionary of the cl derivatives. It is a nested dict, with the primary key being the cosmological/nuisance parameter of the derivative, and the secondary key are the name of the cl combination

  • delta_cls (DeltaClCollection) – the delta cls

  • auto_ells (Optional[Dict[str, ndarray]]) – a dictionary with the multipole ranges for the single probes. The key is the name of the probe, the value is the numpy array with the range

  • auto_f_ells (Optional[Dict[Tuple[str, str], ndarray]]) – a dictionary with the fisher elements for the single probes as functions of ell. The key is the parameters pair for the element, the value is the numpy array with the values of the fisher element in the ells range

Returns

a tuple with: - the multipole range for the current fisher; - a dictionary storing the fisher elements as functions of ell, analogously to the auto_f_ells parameter; - the FisherMatrix object containing the fisher matrix just computed
